meanings.definition: a person or thing that is excluded from a general statement or rule
meanings.sent1: In the classroom, every student had to raise their hand to answer except for Sarah, who was the exception.
meanings.sent2: The rule was that all guests had to wear formal attire to the wedding, but the bride made an exception for her young nephew.
meanings.sent3: At the zoo, all animals were in their enclosures except for the mischievous monkey, who was the exception to the rule.
meanings.sent4: She stood out like an exception in a sea of conformity, her unique style catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The rare flower in the garden was an exception, its vibrant colors standing out among the greenery.

meanings.definition: the action of excluding or not being included within a general statement or rule
meanings.sent1: The exception of Tom from the team was a surprise to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The exception of dessert from the menu left the customers disappointed.
meanings.sent3: The exception of the cat from the group of dogs led to some playful chasing around the yard.
meanings.sent4: The exception of the black sheep in the family made gatherings more interesting.
meanings.sent5: The exception of rain on a sunny day brought unexpected joy to the farmers.

meanings.definition: a case to which a rule does not apply
meanings.sent1: The strange phenomenon was an exception to the usual weather patterns.
meanings.sent2: The unique circumstances of the case made it an exception in the legal system.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ability to swim was an exception to the belief that all cats dislike water.
meanings.sent4: Her resilience in the face of adversity was an exception to the norm.
meanings.sent5: The old tree's ability to bloom in winter was an exception that puzzled the botanists.
